title: Classic Cap Guns & Cowboy Toys
description: Remember the smell of cap gun smoke and the thrill of playing cowboys? Test your knowledge of these classic childhood toys!

questions.question: Cap guns produced their signature 'bang' sound by striking a small disc containing what explosive compound?
What format did caps commonly come in during the 1950s and 1960s?
options: Rolls of red paper with embedded caps

questions.question: Which company was the most famous manufacturer of cap guns in the 1950s, known for their Fanner 50 model?
The Hubley Manufacturing Company, a major cap gun maker, was based in which Pennsylvania town?
What material were most premium cap guns made from in the 1940s and 1950s?
Which TV cowboy's name was commonly found on licensed cap gun and holster sets?
What was the name of the Lone Ranger's famous cap gun set that came with twin silver-colored pistols?
options: The Lone Ranger Double Holster Set

questions.question: Besides cap guns, what other toy weapon was essential for playing cowboys in the 1950s?
The Mattel Fanner 50 cap gun was notable for what realistic feature?
options: It had a working safety lock
It could be fanned like a real revolver by pulling back the hammer

questions.question: What style of cap gun, shaped like a small automatic pistol rather than a revolver, became popular in the 1960s?
Ring caps were a variation that could be loaded into what type of cap gun?
Many children discovered they could make caps go off without a gun by doing what?
options: Hitting them with a rock or hammer

questions.question: What ornate accessory did many cap gun sets include for carrying the guns on your belt?
The 'Greenie Stik-M-Cap' was a type of cap that did what differently?
options: Individual caps stuck to the hammer of the gun

questions.question: By the 1980s, what safety requirement was added to toy guns including cap guns?
options: An orange tip on the barrel
